than ナーシシステックワイズ in
another video he explained
that narcissists aren't really in touch

with their true selves anymore
it's like they've traded it
in for this inflated sense of importance
what he calls a false self

so in his opinion they
can't really be healed
because they no longer exist

as their true selves instead
they're just walking around

as these distorted
reflections of who they used

to be he puts it like this
the false self takes over

and acts as a shield protecting
the narcissist from feeling

vulnerable hurt also known
as narcissistic injury

- They start believing this
false self is the real deal
and expect everyone else

to buy into it too let's look
at the real self situation

of Lee Hammock a clinically
diagnosed individual

with narcissistic personality
disorder he started the self-
aware narcissist movement

and he has been getting
psychotherapy treatment

for about 6 years while therapy
can help manage narcissism

Lee believes that a complete
personality change is rare es

pecially for deep-seated
traits he talks about
how it is much easier for narcissists

to snap back into old behaviors
than learn new patterns Lee

reminds us that true
behavioral changes take time

and consistency and he
doesn't mind getting therapy
for a long time as long as he can continue
to improve himself so back
to our question can narcissists change?
there's no simple yes

or no answer to this question
research is still ongoing
but recent studies suggest that long-

term therapy can make a
difference in developing better
patterns in relationships remember

that change doesn't happen
over time it's a slow process

that needs patience and
consistency a narcissist seeking

help is a good indicator
that change is possible

however no one outside
of them can force them

to change they have to make
that decision themselves

also it's important to
never tolerate manipulation

and abuse if you dealing
with narcissists remember
to set boundaries and take care
of yourself first it can be exhausting
but stay hopeful with time

and support things can get
better have you met a narcissist
who turned a new leaf completely?

Do you think they can actually
stop being narcissists?
